PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. George Pittman, 3613 Frazier Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 28, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think Pennsylvania's 'blue laws' against 'unnecessary' Sunday sales should be enforced?" answer reads: "I think so because it's the Sabbath day and I think that more people should go to service."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Pittman, wearing hat, eyeglasses, plaid shirt, and zippered coat with plush collar, standing in front of light colored marble pillar with men, women, and store windows on either side, one with lamp display
